question_sentence: The coronavirus R rate in Germany has soared following an outbreak at a meat-packing plant in which state?
What is the name of the pro-Trump conspiracy theory that has been promoted by 53 candidates running for seats in the US Congress this year?
Which pop star was forced to deny allegations of sexual assault made by two Twitter users?
A copy of 17th century painting The Immaculate Conception of Los Venerables has been dubbed ‘Potato Madonna’ following a botched restoration, but who painted the original?
What percentage of low-income voters backed the Conservative Party in the December general election, according to a new analysis?
How many British workers are expected to be unable to take up jobs in the US this year after Donald Trump extended an employment-based visa ban?
Boris Johnson said that what was “at an end” this week as he announced the further relaxation of lockdown restrictions from 4 July?
A proposal for bullying and harassment allegations against MPs to be debated in the Commons was defeated by how many votes this week?
Donald Trump hoped to use the music of which musician to help secure peace with North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, according to former US security adviser John Bolton’s new book?
The president of which Balkan country has been indicted on war crime charges just days before he was due to attend peace talks at the White House?
Some of the most populous US states shattered records this week for the number of new coronavirus cases in a single day. Which state did not experience a spike?
evidence: California, Texas and Florida, the three most populous states, saw a dramatic uptick in Covid-19 cases this week. Cases in New York, an early hotspot, are on the decline.

question_sentence: A recent study predicted that which country could see up to 500,000 fewer births than typically expected because of the coronavirus pandemic?
evidence: The United States could experience a drop of about 300,000 to 500,000 births due to Covid-19, according to the Brookings Institute and March of Dimes. The analysis compared birth rates after major events in history, including the 1918 influenza pandemic.

question_sentence: Trump’s return to the campaign trail in Tulsa, Oklahoma, drew a smaller-than-expected crowd. Fans of which music genre are being partially credited with tricking his campaign into thinking more supporters would show up?
evidence: Along with TikTok users, K-Pop fans used social media to encourage followers to register for the event, but not actually show up. The Trump campaign said more than one million people registered for the rally, but ultimately just fewer than 6,200 attended.

question_sentence: A 7.4 magnitude earthquake struck the southern part of which country?
evidence: The earthquake struck in Mexico’s Oaxaca state, and could be felt as far as Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. Mexico is located on three tectonic plates and is one of the most seismically active regions on the planet.

question_sentence: A historic dust plume traveled over 5,000 miles across the Atlantic Ocean, the Caribbean, the Gulf of Mexico and to the US. In what desert did the plume form?
evidence: The large dust cloud was lifted into the atmosphere from the Sahara Desert and transported west. The phenomenon is not unusual, but atmospheric changes led to unprecedented high concentrations of dust this time around.

question_sentence: The mayor of which US city announced they would persuade demonstrators to leave an “autonomous zone” that was occupied to demand police reform?
evidence: Seattle Mayor Jenny Durkan said the city would work with Black-led community organizations to clear the area. The de facto leader of the protest zone, which had drawn attention from critics, said days later that many demonstrators were leaving.

question_sentence: Scientists discovered that giant wombat-like creatures, the size of a black bear, roamed the Earth some 25 million years ago. On what continent was the fossil that led to the discovery found?
evidence: A team of researchers from the United Kingdom discovered the new family of marsupials after studying the partial skull and most of a skeleton collected from Lake Pinpa, in northeastern South Australia during the 1970s. They named the animal “Mukupirna,” meaning “big bones” in the indigenous languages Dieri and Malyangapa.

question_sentence: More than 100 people were killed this week by lightning strikes in which country?
evidence: The lightning strikes killed at least 107 people across the Indian states of Uttar Pradesh and Bihar. India, and South Asia more widely, often has lightning fatalities in May and June each year.

question_sentence: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announced this week that a statue in front of the American Museum of Natural History would be removed. Which US president does it depict?
evidence: The statue features the nation’s 26th President on a horse with a Native American man and an African man standing on each side. The museum said it was meant to celebrate Roosevelt’s contributions to conservation, but also communicated a “disturbing” racial hierarchy.

question_sentence: This YouTube star decided to leave the platform over old controversial videos featuring blackface and other offensive content.
evidence: In her apology, Jenna Mourey, known by her channel name Jenna Marbles, highlighted videos from 2011 and 2012 — one featuring a blackface impression of rapper Nicki Minaj, another featuring a joke about Asians, and one video slamming women who "slept around."

question_sentence: The US is on course for the highest election turnout in more than a century, with how many voters casting their ballots before polls even opened?
A train that crashed through a protective barrier in the Dutch city of Rotterdam was saved from plunging into a canal by landing on what?
US Republican candidate David Andahl has been voted into the North Dakota House of Representatives, but what makes his appointment unusual?
choices: He did not realise he was on the ballot
He wants North Dakota to declare independence from the US

question_sentence: The UK has signed deals to buy how many doses of a total of six coronavirus vaccines, all of which are currently undergoing trials?
Johnny Depp this week lost his libel claim against which UK newspaper over an article that described the actor as a ‘wife beater’?
What was the most important issue for Americans voting in the US presidential election, according to an exit poll by Edison Research?
Boris Johnson’s former economic advisor Gerard Lyons this week forecast that the UK’s final-quarter GDP could shrink by up to how much as a result of the latest Covid lockdown?
The BBC is launching an inquiry into claims by Princess Diana’s brother that journalist Martin Bashir used what to help secure her infamous Panorama interview?
Nigel Farage is returning to the political spotlight to relaunch the Brexit Party as an anti-lockdown party under what name?
A man has credited his pet what with saving him from a fire at their home in Brisbane, Australia?
The FBI is launching an investigation into alleged harassment by motorists flying Trump flags in Texas. What are they accused of harassing just before Election Day?
evidence: Motorists as part of a “Trump Train” allegedly harassed a Biden campaign bus that was on its way from San Antonio to Austin. Biden staffers, though rattled, were unharmed during the incident.

question_sentence: November 2nd marks the day that humans first arrived at the International Space Station (ISS). Which anniversary was celebrated on Monday?
evidence: The ISS first welcomed humans onboard 20 years ago. American astronaut William Shepherd and Russian cosmonauts Yuri Gidzenko and Sergei Krikalev first entered the ISS on November 2, 2000.

question_sentence: Authorities named Fejzulai Kujtim as the shooter in a terrorist attack killing four people in Europe. Where did this happen?
evidence: The attack occurred in Vienna, Austria. Kujtim, ultimately killed by police, was a known ISIS sympathizer and was convicted of attempting to travel to Syria to fight for the terror group.

question_sentence: Hurricane Eta made landfall as a category 4 storm on Tuesday. Where?
evidence: Hurricane Eta made landfall in Nicaragua with sustained wind speeds of 140 mph. The National Hurricane Center warned of “life-threatening storm surge, catastrophic winds and flash flooding occurring over portions of Central America.”

question_sentence: An article published in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences found that which animal can “predict the future” by estimating the path of their prey?
evidence: Researchers found that bats use echolocation, a process through which they emit ultrasonic calls and use the information from returning echoes to create a 3D model of the space around them and anticipate the path of prey.

question_sentence: Denmark is planning to cull 17 million of what animal to stop the spread of a mutated version of the coronavirus?
evidence: Denmark, the world’s largest producer of mink fur, is culling 17 million minks after it found that 5 specimens were infected with a mutated version that had spread to twelve humans.

question_sentence: Joe Biden managed to win back at least two “Blue Wall” states that Donald Trump had claimed against Hillary Clinton in 2016. Which one of the following is NOT part of the Blue wall?
evidence: Texas, traditionally a conservative state, is not part of the “Blue Wall,” a string of upper Midwestern states that are considered reliably Democratic.

question_sentence: To much fanfare, which company launched its own brand of tequila this week?
evidence: Tesla announced “Tesla Tequila,” a product that CEO Elon Musk has been teasing for years. Available only in select US states, the liquor sold out within hours despite being limited to two bottles per order.

question_sentence: Karen Lynch will be promoted to CEO, making her the 40th female chief executive on the Fortune 500 list. Which company does she work for?
evidence: Lynch, currently the executive vice president of CVS Health and president of Aetna, will replace the current CEO, Larry Merlo, on February 1.

question_sentence: A crate filled with what item was auctioned off for nearly $9,600 at Tokyo’s wholesale Ota Market?
evidence: A crate of 100 Japanese mandarin oranges was auctioned off, making it the year’s first auction of satsuma mandarin oranges, a famous citrus species from Ehime prefecture on the island of Shikoku.

question_sentence: Monkeys in which country stole blood samples from Covid-19 tests, triggering fears of a further spread of the virus?
What is the name of the former aide to Sajid Javid who is bringing a sex discrimination claim against the government after being fired by Dominic Cummings last year?
Which movement did Donald Trump this week threaten to designate as a “terrorist organisation” in the US?
New research has linked the vaccine for which illness to lower coronavirus infection rates?
What is the name of the CNN journalist arrested live on air while reporting on the George Floyd protests in Minneapolis?
The house where Adolf Hitler was born is being renovated and turned into what?
How many Hong Kongers caught up in China’s new security laws may be offered a route to British citizenship under newly announced Downing Street plans?
Which nation’s health minister is facing corruption allegations after purchasing £1m of coronavirus PPE from a family friend?
The new suspect in the investigation into the disappearance of Madeleine McCann is being referred to by what name in media reports?
Donald Trump is threating to deploy military forces against US race protesters by invoking which federal law?
Which of these former Minneapolis Police officer was charged with second-degree murder for the killing of George Floyd?
evidence: Though all four officers have been charged, Chauvin, who pressed his knee into Floyd’s neck for nearly nine minutes, was previously charged with third-degree murder and second-degree manslaughter. The new second-degree murder charge says he killed Floyd “without intent” in the course of committing assault in the third degree.

question_sentence: In reference to kneeling during the national anthem, which NFL player received backlash after saying he will “never agree with anybody disrespecting the flag”?
evidence: The New Orleans Saints quarterback’s comments sparked criticism from the likes of LeBron James and Brees’ own teammate, Malcom Jenkins.

question_sentence: In an effort to sell cars that are better for the environment, which country is spending billions on subsidies to lower the cost of electric cars?
evidence: The German government will double existing subsidies to €6,000 ($6,720) on electric vehicles that cost up to €40,000 ($44,800).

question_sentence: Which digital communications company’s revenue has soared 169% during the ongoing coronavirus pandemic?
evidence: Zoom’s revenue has skyrocketed 169% from the prior year to $328 million for the three months ending with April, as it became the go-to video conferencing service for many stuck at home during the pandemic.

question_sentence: Joe Biden made his first campaign trip outside of his home state of Delaware since the pandemic halted campaign events. Where did he go?
evidence: Biden gave a speech in Philadelphia addressing systemic racism.

question_sentence: As China prepares to impose a new national security law on Hong Kong, this world leader promised to provide a path to citizenship for potentially millions of Hong Kong citizens.
evidence: Johnson promised in an op-ed that the United Kingdom will “uphold our profound ties of history and friendship with the people of Hong Kong,” by changing immigration laws to allow more Hong Kong citizens to settle and work in the country.

question_sentence: This football star became the first player to break $1 billion in lifetime earnings.
evidence: Ronaldo has made $650 million through football alone, with the rest coming from an array of endorsement deals off the pitch.

question_sentence: The NBA Board of Governors approved a plan that would continue the season with a reduced number of teams. How many teams will play?
choices: All 32 teams, there is no reduction
evidence: The new plan would see 13 Western Conference teams and nine Eastern Conference teams play eight “seeding” games to determine seeds in the playoffs.

question_sentence: The cast of which popular crime television show donated $100,000 to bail relief funds for protesters?
evidence: “Brooklyn 99” showrunner and co-creator Dan Goor condemned the death of George Floyd in a statement, while urging others to contribute to bail funds.

question_sentence: A former president of what country has called for the impeachment of the current president?
evidence: Former Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva blames current president Jair Bolsonaro for the devastation caused by Covid-19, and called his handling of the pandemic “irresponsible” and “negligent.”

question_sentence: Mike Bloomberg has dropped out of the Democratic presidential nominee race after spending how much on his campaign?
Which African sporting competition has been postponed as a result of the coronavirus outbreak?
The coronavirus epidemic has also resulted in the postponement of England’s Six Nations rugby match against Italy - but England’s fixture against which side is still going ahead this weekend?
According to a new National Audit Office report, the UK government has spent a minimum of how much on Brexit preparations?
The newly renamed comedian Hugo Boss was formerly known as what?
Prince William tried his hand at which circus skill during a visit to Ireland this week?
The collapse of UK airline Flybe this week has put how many jobs at risk?
A new UN study of 75 countries found that 91% of men and what percentage of women hold some sort of bias against women?
The release of which film has been put back by seven months as a result of the coronavirus outbreak?
Financial Conduct Authority chief Andrew Bailey has faced a grilling from the Treasury Select Committee this week, ahead of starting which new job on 16 March?
choices: Governor of the Bank of England

question_sentence: Joe Biden’s success in the Super Tuesday elections drastically altered the Democratic primary. Among the surprises was his victory in this state, which is the home state of then-fellow candidate Elizabeth Warren.
evidence: Elizabeth Warren dropped out of the race days after losing her home state of Massachusetts to Joe Biden on Super Tuesday.

question_sentence: What TV staple is coming to an end after 25 years on the air?
evidence: Judy Sheindlin announced her show “Judge Judy” would end next year, marking the show’s silver anniversary.

question_sentence: This country has one of the highest numbers of coronavirus cases outside of China, and is the hardest-hit country in the Middle East, with more than 3,500 infected and 100 dead.
evidence: Iran has taken drastic lengths, including temporarily freeing thousands of prisoners, to slow the spread of the coronavirus. The country is also working on a vaccine.

question_sentence: Apple could pay up to half a billion dollars to settle a class action lawsuit alleging the company engaged in what concerning practice?
choices: Restricting cell service to some phones
Selling refurbished phones as new ones
evidence: Apple will settle a lawsuit alleging the company slowed down old phones to encourage people to buy newer models. They have been asked to pay $25 per affected device, which could total as much as $500 million.

question_sentence: Pete Buttigieg also dropped out of the Democratic presidential race this week, but we learned some interesting facts about the Maltese origins of his last name. What does “Buttigieg” roughly translate to?
evidence: Citizens on the European island nation of Malta followed Buttigieg’s campaign with interest, particularly because of his familiar last name, which roughly means “lord of poultry.”

question_sentence: What country ousted its Prime Minister this week?
evidence: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelensky replaced Prime Minister Oleksiy Honcharuk (pictured) a month after Honcharuk was recorded criticizing Zelinsky’s policies.

question_sentence: Australia’s new South Wales is finally free of the scourge of brush fires that ravaged the region for months. How long did the fires burn there?
evidence: The fires burned the areas for approximately 240 days, killing millions of animals and destroying an untold number of structures.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court heard its first major case on what controversial topic since the addition of two Trump nominees gave the court a conservative majority?
evidence: The high court is debating a controversial Louisiana abortion access law, and their decision could affect long-held precedents on states’ rights to restrict physicians who perform abortions.

question_sentence: Twitter is testing new temporary posts, similar to Instagram and Facebook stories. What are these disappearing posts called?
evidence: Twitter is jumping on the disappearing content bandwagon with “Fleets.” Currently, the feature is only being tested in Brazil.

question_sentence: The Democratic Republic of Congo is celebrating what they hope is the end of a nearly two-year outbreak of what disease?
evidence: An Ebola epidemic killed more than 2,200 people in the region over the last 20 months, but the discharge of the country’s last Ebola patient has brought optimism that the outbreak can be successfully conquered.

question_sentence: Which TV game-show host died at the age of 80 this week after a battle with pancreatic cancer?
evidence: Alex Trebek, host of the beloved TV game show “Jeopardy!”, died on Sunday. Trebek hosted more than 8,200 episodes over 37 seasons.

question_sentence: Which company announced a breakthrough in developing a coronavirus vaccine, claiming early data from clinical trials shows it’s 90% effective?
evidence: Pfizer CEO Albert Bourla announced the results, describing the vaccine as a “game changer.” International governing bodies, including the European Union, have since authorized the procurement of millions of doses of the vaccine.

question_sentence: Ben Carson is one of the latest members of President Trump’s inner circle to be infected with coronavirus. What’s his position?
choices: Secretary of Housing and Urban Development
evidence: Ben Carson is the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development. The announcement comes after dozens in Trump’s inner circle have been infected, including White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows and advisor Corey Lewandowski.

question_sentence: Christie’s auction house continued offering what space-themed items in its “Voyage to Another World” sale?
evidence: The sale, known as “Voyage to Another World: The Victor Martin-Malburet Photograph Collection,” includes 2,400 rare NASA photos taken across multiple missions and generations of space exploration. Included is the only photo showing Neil Armstrong on the moon.

question_sentence: Which named storm made four landfalls across multiple countries before heading into the Atlantic Ocean?
evidence: Eta made landfall four times, first as a Category 4 hurricane in Central America and most recently as a tropical storm battering the Southeastern part of the United States. The 2020 Atlantic hurricane season is the busiest on record after the formation of Theta, its 29th named storm.

question_sentence: Which US state was the first to top 1 million total Covid-19 infections?
evidence: Texas was the first state to surpass 1 million coronavirus infections – almost a tenth of the nearly 11 million cases reported in the US, which has the most confirmed cases in the world. California was soon to follow and now has over 1 million cases.

question_sentence: Ron Klain is one of the first people President-elect Joe Biden has named to his cabinet. For what position is he being tapped?
evidence: A well-known insider in Democratic politics and longtime Biden confidant, Klain will serve as Biden’s Chief of Staff. Klain was a key figure in the Obama White House, overseeing the administration’s Ebola crisis response and advising on the Great Recession.

question_sentence: Joseph Webster was exonerated after serving 15 years in prison for a brutal slaying he didn’t commit. Where did this happen?
evidence: The Davidson County District Attorney’s Office, located in Nashville, Tennessee, made the announcement of Webster’s exoneration.

question_sentence: More than a week after the election CNN projected Joe Biden winning which of the following Republican strongholds?
evidence: President-elect Joe Biden flipped Arizona, becoming only the second Democrat to win the state since 1948 and the first since Bill Clinton in 1996.

question_sentence: The SeaDream 1 cruise ship, now dealing with the fallout of a coronavirus outbreak, was the first cruise vessel to set sail in which region since the start of the pandemic?
evidence: SeaDream 1’s voyage was cut short in the Caribbean after a preliminary positive test result in the Grenadines. At least five people on board have tested positive for coronavirus.

question_sentence: Which recently extinct animal species is due to be brought back to life using an experimental stem-cell technique?
The UK’s revamped coronavirus tracking app was trialled this week in which region of the country?
In a “historic” deal this week, the United Arab Emirates became the third Arab nation to formalise diplomatic ties with Israel. What are the other two?
Which British cheese was revealed to have been a stumbling block to trade talks between the UK and Japan this week?
Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden this week named Kamala Harris as his running mate for the forthcoming election. For which US state is Harris a senator?
After a wave of high-profile cancellations, which men’s tennis star has confirmed that he will appear at the 2020 US Open?
New Zealand this week confirmed new Covid-19 infections that ended a lengthy run with no local transmissions of the virus. How long had the country gone without registering a new case?
How many A-level in England students saw their results downgraded by a government-endorsed algorithm in the exam “fiasco” this week?
Belarus was plunged into chaos following an election in which President Alexander Lukashenko extended his reign despite accusations of electoral fraud. When did the strongman come to power?
World leaders met to discuss the crisis in Lebanon following the explosion in Beirut. Who called the meeting?
choices: Angela Merkel, the Chancellor of Germany
Giuseppe Conte, the Prime Minister of Italy
Boris Johnson, the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Emmanuel Macron, the President of France
evidence: French president Emmanuel Macron called for an international donor’s conference and spoke by video chat to several world leaders to discuss the crisis in Lebanon. In addition to rallying aid, he called for major reforms within the country, adding, “The explosion of August 4 was like a thunderbolt. It’s time to wake up and take action.”

question_sentence: Several US lawmakers were sanctioned for “behaving badly” on specific foreign relations issues. Which country issued the sanctions?
evidence: China issued sanctions against 11 American individuals, including six lawmakers, for “behaving badly on Hong Kong-related issues.” The move comes after the United States sanctioned 11 Chinese and Hong Kong officials, including Hong Kong Chief Executive Carrie Lam, for their role in crackdowns on political freedoms, further increasing tensions.

question_sentence: Which annual meteor shower reached its peak this week?
evidence: The Perseid meteor shower put on a show for stargazers as the Earth made its pass through the Swift-Tuttle comet debris field – a comet that orbits the sun every 133 years. Perseids are brighter meteors than other annual meteor showers.

question_sentence: Joe Biden made history by picking Sen. Kamala Harris to be his vice presidential nominee, making her the first Black woman on a presidential ticket. What position was part of her many years of public service?
choices: Attorney for the Southern District of New York
evidence: Kamala Harris served as district attorney in San Francisco and attorney general of California, the state she’s currently serving as a US senator. Harris is a first-generation American with an Indian mother and Jamaican father.

question_sentence: Disney is changing the name of 20th Century Fox Television, one of the most recognized brands in entertainment. What will the new name be?
evidence: Disney is changing the name of its TV studio 20th Century Fox Television to 20th Television, opting to drop “Century” and “Fox” from the name. The company’s film studio – previously known as 20th Century Fox – had already been rebranded as 20th Century Studios at the start of the year.

question_sentence: Following a contested landslide victory for the incumbent president, where did the opposition candidate flee following Belarus’s latest presidential election?
evidence: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya, the opposition candidate to Belarusian president Alexander Lukashenko, fled the country to Lithuania. Government crackdowns began after protestors flocked to the streets protesting the legitimacy of the election results. The US, its European allies and other groups have publicly disputed the results, with many referring to Lukashenko as “Europe’s last dictator.”

question_sentence: Israel and which other country have agreed to reestablish a normalization of diplomatic relations?
evidence: US President Donald Trump announced the peace deal between Israel and the United Arab Emirates. It’s been coined the “Abraham Accord,” which US Ambassador to Israel David Friedman said is named after “the father of all three great faiths” – Christian, Muslim and Jewish. A major component of the deal is Israel’s agreement to suspend plans to annex the West Bank.

question_sentence: Which country went from a 102-day streak with no locally transmitted coronavirus infections to suddenly having a cluster of new cases?
evidence: New Zealand reported a new, locally transmitted cluster of cases in Aukland, the country’s most populous city, after a 102-day streak without a single reported incident of local infection. Jacinda Ardern, the country’s Prime Minister, implemented a new lockdown in the city as a precaution and to conduct contact tracing.

question_sentence: Chinese authorities discovered which food product infected with coronavirus after being imported from Brazil?
evidence: Frozen, Brazilian-sourced chicken wings were found to have tested positive for coronavirus in the Chinese city of Shenzhen. Though the brand was not identified, local authorities issued a statement that testing and tracing found no signs of the product infecting humans. Organizations like the World Health Organization and US Centers for Disease Control say the probability of contracting the virus through food is low.

question_sentence: Apple recently announced a stock split. What company announced they were following suit?
evidence: Tesla announced a five-for-one stock split, effective August 31. Stock splits create more shares for a company without altering the dollar value of a single individual’s existing investment. With more shares offered at an initially cheaper price comes the likelihood of more investors. Tesla, which was trading at over $1,600 on Friday, noted in a statement that they look to “make stock ownership more accessible to employees and investors.”

question_sentence: Subway has run into a dispute with the Irish Supreme Court over what unusual ruling?
choices: Its bread is not legally bread
It is legally required to open more stores

question_sentence: Which NGO has halted all operations in India, citing a “witch-hunt” by Narendra Modi’s government?
On which UK overseas territory has the Home Office reportedly considered building an asylum centre?
Which bodily fluid have Chinese researchers suggested may prevent or treat coronavirus?
How did Donald Trump respond when asked to denounce far-right group the Proud Boys during the first presidential debate?
Azerbaijan and Armenia are currently embroiled in a  conflict for control over which disputed territory?
Donald Trump is thought to have avoided paying any federal income taxes in how many of the past 15 years, according to a report in The New York Times?
South Korean boy band BTS’ management label, Big Hit Entertainment, has been valued at what price ahead of an IPO this month?
The authorities have abandoned plans to exempt which institutions from the nationwide 10pm curfew on public places?
choices: Bars in the Houses of Parliament
Pubs in the borough of Kensington and Chelsea

question_sentence: Which former tennis player attacked Andy Murray after he suffered a heavy defeat in the French Open first round?
Which head of state visited President Trump this week?
choices: Justin Trudeau, the Prime Minister of Canada
Jair Bolsonaro, the President of Brazil
Angela Merkel, the Chancellor of Germany
Andrés Manuel López Obrador, the President of Mexico
evidence: Andrés Manuel López Obrador joined President Trump for a summit this week to celebrate the implementation of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) trade deal.

question_sentence: Nick Cordero died after a months-long, painstaking battle with Covid-19. What was Cordero best known for?
evidence: Cordero, married to former co-performer Amanda Kloots, was a Broadway actor known the world over for his workin stage productions such as “Bullets over Broadway” and “Waitress”. After contracting Covid-19 in March, the actor suffered several complications including the amputation of both of his legs before succumbing to the disease. He was 41 years old.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court handed down rulings on several big cases this week. Which one of these was NOT among the politically-charged topics addressed by this week’s major decisions?
evidence: Among SCOTUS’ rulings this week were ones regarding religious freedoms of employers and schools, President Trump’s ability to claim immunity during legal proceedings, and Native American land rights in Oklahoma.

question_sentence: What does the term “positivity rate” refer to?
choices: How happy the American people are
The percentage of people who test positive for coronavirus
The percentage of people who are secure in their choice for Presidential candidate
How stock markets forecast future investments
evidence: The term “positivity rate” is being used to describe how many people are testing positive for coronavirus, out of the total number of people tested. Many leaders and experts are using the metric to counter arguments that increases in case numbers are simply the result of more people being tested.

question_sentence: The mayor of which US city tested positive for coronavirus?
evidence: Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms of Atlanta tested positive for coroanvirus, along with her husband and son. This comes at a time when the nation is dealing with a public health crisis and reckoning on racial justice in the United States. She is also considered to be on the shortlist for Joe Biden’s VP nominee.

question_sentence: Disney is signing a production deal with which professional athlete in the hopes of expanding its coverage of issues pertaining to “social injustice and the quest for equity”?
evidence: Colin Kaepernick signed a deal with Disney to produce a documentary film about his life, going from athlete to activist. Kaepernick is most known for kneeling for the National Anthem as a form of protest during his time in the NFL.

question_sentence: The US is looking at banning several social media platforms with ties to China, including which wildly popular app? The possibility of the ban was announced by Secretary of State Mike Pompeo and President Trump.
evidence: TikTok is among the Chinese platforms being considered. Some politicans think the platform, which is owned by the Chinese company ByteDance, is a threat to national security.

question_sentence: Which Latin music star just made history on the cover of “Playboy?”
evidence: Puerto Rican trap artist Bad Bunny covered Playboy, showing off his iconic style and discussing alternative expressions of masculinity and Latin identity. He’s the first man to appear solo on the cover, other than the publication’s founder, Hugh Hefner.

question_sentence: Which deadly contagion has the potential of making a resurgence in the Chinese region of Inner Mongolia after an official diagnosis confirmed human infection?
evidence: Bayannur, a city in the Chinese region of inner Mongolia, is on high alert after a patient contracted bubonic plague, a bacterial infection that caused the deadliest pandemic in human history in the fourteenth century.

question_sentence: More than 153 writers, artists, academics and journalists, including J.K. Rowling and Margaret Atwood, signed an open letter decrying what controversial topic?
choices: Sexual harassment in the entertainment industry
evidence: The letter, published by Harper’s Magazine, lamented a culture in which "intolerance of opposing views, a vogue for public shaming and ostracism, and the tendency to dissolve complex policy issues in a blinding moral certainty" have, in their eyes, become rampant. The letter follows outrage over several transphobic comments made by “Harry Potter” author J.K. Rowling.

question_sentence: China is poised to enact a total ban on imports of what as of 1 January?
choices: Solid waste including plastic, scrap paper and textiles
Tech equipment developed by rival nations
Books deemed to promote Western values

question_sentence: How many of the total 40 million doses of the Pfizer vaccine ordered by the UK government are due to arrive by next week?
How many Conservative MPs defied Boris Johnson this week by voting against the new tiered system of Covid restrictions?
An investigation by The Times has revealed that what percentage of bridges in England are in a ‘poor’ or ‘very poor’ condition?
Which of these high-street brands isnotowned by Philip Green’s collapsed Arcadia Group?
What animal has been revealed to have bitten Johnny Rotten’s penis while the punk rocker was befriending local squirrels?
Which of these celebrities is the UK government reportedly eyeing up to front a campaign to convince the public that the Covid-19 vaccine is safe to use?
A Thai man stumbled upon what surprisingly valuable rare find worth £2.4m this week?
choices: A worm with medicinal properties that was thought to have gone extinct
A previously undiscovered edible seaweed species

question_sentence: Newly leaked files from Wuhan suggest the Chinese government was also battling a ‘significant’ outbreak of what disease in the region when the Covid pandemic began?
Campaigners this week called on the UK government to honour its pledge to work towards eliminating what virus by 2030?
Which country ultimately voted against the Responsible Business Initiative, a mandate that would have held the country’s companies liable for human rights and environmental abuses committed abroad?
evidence: Though the slight majority of Swiss citizens supported the initiative, it failed to gain support from the majority of its cantons, or Swiss states – both required in order to pass.

question_sentence: President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris have selected an all-female White House senior communications team. What former Obama administration official did Biden tap to be his press secretary?
evidence: Though all of these women will be part of the White House team, Jen Psaki was picked to be the White House press secretary. Psaki formerly served as White House communications director during Barack Obama’s presidency.

question_sentence: Which pharmaceutical company became the third to apply for FDA authorization of its Covid-19 vaccine?
evidence: Moderna applied for US Food and Drug Administration authorization of its vaccine on Monday. Pfizer and German partner BioNTech were the first companies to apply in November.

question_sentence: Which country just authorized the Pfizer & BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine, the first such authorization in the world?
evidence: The United Kingdom, one of the countries hardest hit by the coronavirus, authorized the vaccine and purchased an initial 40 million doses – enough to vaccinate 20 million people.

question_sentence: Which car company is scrapping plans to build Nikola Motor’s Badger pickup truck and is also giving up equity stake in the electric truck company?
evidence: General Motors is making the moves, all part of a scaled-back deal with Nikola Motors. The decision comes after a report was released following the initial September deal that contained allegations of fraud against Nikola and its then-chairman Trevor Milton.

question_sentence: Attorney General William Barr appointed Connecticut US Attorney John Durham to act as special counsel for an investigation. What will Durham be investigating?
choices: rampant voter fraud in the 2020 election
potential violations by law enforcement in the 2016 election
evidence: As special counsel, Durham will investigate whether law enforcement and intelligence agencies violated the law in their monitoring of the Trump Campaign during the 2016 election, a sticking point that President Trump has repeatedly called a “witch hunt.”

question_sentence: A study published in the journal Science Advances postulates that if life ever existed on this specific planet, it may have been subsurface. What planet may have hosted this subterranean life?
evidence: The study looked at potential life on ancient Mars, concluding that life was possible billions of years ago, but likely subsurface when taking into account the faint young sun paradox – a contradiction between climate modeling and the geologic record of Mars.

question_sentence: Former US presidents Barack Obama, George W. Bush and Bill Clinton have teamed up to promote what specific action?
choices: avoiding travel during the holiday season
evidence: The three former presidents have teamed up to promote the Covid-19 vaccine once it receives FDA authorization. Each have volunteered to get the vaccine on camera, all to encourage public confidence.

question_sentence: Politicians from various Western countries encouraged consumers to buy what specific Australian product following major tariffs that China has levied on the good?
evidence: Politicians have asked consumers to buy Australian wine, a product that China has recently tariffed at more than 200%, an action that may completely shut the door to Australia’s presence in China’s wine market.

question_sentence: Slack, a popular workplace messaging app, is being purchased for $27.7 billion. Which company is making the acquisition?
evidence: Salesforce is buying the messaging company, making it the largest acquisition in its history.

question_sentence: Which SNP politician this week argued that “the incompetent handling” of the Covid-19 crisis by Westminster “builds the case” for Scottish independence?
Newly published data from the Office of National Statistics (ONS) shows that Britain’s GDP fell by how much in March?
Boris Johnson has been photographed holding a memo that urged him not to meet alone with which senior Tory MP?
The head of which country’s industry federation this week warned that a no-deal Brexit would be ‘catastrophe’ for the UK?
Which airline is reportedly seeking both private investors and a £500m bailout from the government in a bid to stave off collapse?
Australian scientists have proposed what new solution to help protect coral reefs from climate change?
choices: Moving icebergs to warm water to decrease the temperature
Genetically engineering coral algae to tolerate heat
Creating rain clouds to decrease evaporation

question_sentence: People convicted of deliberately coughing on or spitting at front-line workers during the coronavirus outbreak can be sentenced to a maximum of how long in prison?
The US embassy in which African nation has warned that there is a risk of “exponential growth” of Covid-19 cases in the country?
A healthcare firm advised by which Conservative MP has been handed a £133m coronavirus testing contract ‘unopposed’?
By how much did the number of TV licences bought in the UK fall in the five months to March?

A collective $72.9 billion was spent on nuclear weapons by the world’s nuclear-armed nations in 2019, according to a report released this week. Which country accounted for about half of that, with about $35.4 billion spent?
evidence: The US spent $35.4 billion on nuclear weapons in 2019, about half of the collective total.

question_sentence: Which two major media companies made major job cuts this week, in an effort to stave off economic fallout from the coronavirus?
evidence: Despite earlier cuts made by both companies, Condé Nast is laying off about 100 staffers in the US and furloughing about another 100, while BuzzFeed has made cuts to both its UK and Australia offices.

question_sentence: The family of Breonna Taylor has filed a wrongful death lawsuit after Taylor, an EMT, was shot and killed in March while local police were executing a search warrant in a narcotics investigation.  Where did the shooting occur?
evidence: The incident occurred at Taylor’s Louisville home, where a man involved in a drug ring was allegedly sending shipments in order to avoid detection. At the time of her death, a suspect had already been apprehended at another location.

question_sentence: Star MLB pitcher Blake Snell said this week he wouldn’t take a pay cut to return to playing baseball this year, because the risk is higher. What team does he play for?
evidence: “You all are going to be like, ‘Blake, play for the love of the game – what’s wrong with you? The money should not be a thing,’” the Rays player said. “Bro. I am risking my life.” His sentiments echo other opinions around the baseball community.

question_sentence: Which athlete celebrated their birthday this week by announcing the return of two iconic video games?
evidence: “Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater” 1 and 2 are being remastered for Xbox One, PlayStation 4 and PC, the skater announced this week, to be released on September 4.

question_sentence: The governor of which state walked back a previous executive order this week, which issued thousands of licenses to teen drivers without a driver’s test due to the pandemic?
evidence: Gov. Brian Kemp of Georgia signed a new executive order this week, saying that those teens given licenses will have to take a driver’s test after all.

question_sentence: The coronavirus-induced economic downturn is especially affecting low-income households. What percentage of low-income households reported a job loss in March, according to a new report?
evidence: Nearly 40% of those with a household income below $40,000 reported a job loss in March, according to the Economic Well-Being of US Households report.

question_sentence: Hundreds of factory workers at a fish processing plant have tested positive for coronavirus, all from contact with a single worker. Where is the factory located?
evidence: More than 500 employees were infected at the factory, located in the port city of Tema.

question_sentence: Which senator stepped down as Intelligence Committee chairman this week, after the FBI seized his phone as part of a probe into stock transactions he made ahead of the market downturn?
evidence: Senator Burr, A Republican from North Carolina, has been scrutinized for selling up to $1.7 million in stocks in February after he received closed-door briefings about the virus before the market began trending downward.

question_sentence: Which state’s Capitol was closed Thursday, due to demonstrators gathering to protest extended stay-at-home orders?
evidence: The latest protest in Michigan came two weeks after protesters, some armed, entered the Capitol building and demanded to be allowed into the legislative chambers.

question_sentence: How many of the US Senate’s 100 members voted to convict Donald Trump of abuse of power at his impeachment trial?
Online critics said an off-the-shoulder dress worn by Tracy Brabin in the Commons this week made the Labour MP look like she was... ?
choices: Just banged over a wheelie bin

question_sentence: According to the Turkish defence minister, how many Syrian soldiers were “neutralised” in retaliatory air strikes in Idlib on Monday?
The UK government has announced plans to bring forward a ban on the sale of new petrol and diesel cars to which year?
Malawi’s Constitutional Court has annulled the result of the country’s 2019 presidential election because of which “irregularities”?
choices: Results papers were altered with Tipp-Ex or a similar correction fluid
Electronic ballot machines were hit by technical issues
Russia is believed to have interfered

question_sentence: Who does former House of Commons speaker John Bercow call a “weirdo” in his newly published memoirs?
Seven men went on trial in Paris this week charged with conning high-profile figures out of millions of euros by impersonating whom?
choices: France’s then-defence minister Jean-Yves Le Drian

question_sentence: The first lady of Lesotho has fled the small African country after being asked to report to police for questioning in connection with which crime?
choices: An attempt to overthrow her husband as ruler
Embezzlement of funds from a state-owned diamond mining company
The murder of her husband’s former wife

question_sentence: Which controversial figure was awarded America's highest civilian honour during Donald Trump's State of the Union address?
Which Labour leadership candidate this week unveiled an eight-point plan to reform the party?
Which two performers brought glitz, glamor and a little bit of political commentary to this year’s Super Bowl halftime show?
evidence: Jennifer Lopez and Shakira turned the Super Bowl halftime show into a dance party, and JLo paid tribute to her Puerto Rican heritage.

question_sentence: The Trump Administration extended their controversial travel ban to include which four countries?
choices: Myanmar, Ethiopia, Somalia and North Korea
evidence: Under the new provisions to the travel ban, immigrants from Myanmar, Eritrea, Kyrgyzstan and Nigeria will be barred from settling in the US.  In addition, Tanzanian and Sudanese citizens won't be outright banned, but they will no longer be able to apply for the green card lottery.

question_sentence: Punxsutawney Phil did not see his shadow on Groundhog Day, which according to legend means we’ll have…
choices: A major shakeup in the meteorology field
evidence: No shadow typically means an early spring, but records show the groundhog is usually wrong with his predictions. Probably because he is a groundhog.

question_sentence: The Iowa caucuses devolved into several days of uncertainty when vote reporting was delayed due to what complication?
choices: The surprise withdrawal of a candidate
A glitch with a vote reporting app
evidence: The delay in results was blamed on a badly designed vote reporting app.

question_sentence: The Senate voted to acquit President Trump on both articles of impeachment, ending the four-month long impeachment saga. What Republican Senator made history by voting against President Trump on one of the two articles of impeachment?
evidence: Mitt Romney is the first Senator to vote to remove a President of his own party.

question_sentence: During his annual State of the Union address, President Trump awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom to what Conservative media personality?
evidence: Trump awarded Limbaugh the honor during a surprise ceremony. The conservative radio host recently announced he has advanced lung cancer.

question_sentence: Approximately how many subscribers has Disney+ netted since the streaming service first rolled out in November? The number has smashed expectations, despite the obvious popularity of Disney content.
evidence: Disney’s CEO Bob Iger announced the streaming service had reached nearly 29 million subscribers in its first three months.

question_sentence: The first lady of this African nation has been charged with murdering her husband’s former wife.
evidence: Lestho’s Maesaiah Thabane has been charged with murder following the 2017 killing of Lipolelo Thabane. Prime Minister Thomas Thabane, Maesaiah’s husband, has agreed to step down from his position amid the legal storm.

question_sentence: According to a new study out of Canada, which of these activities is the most dangerous for pedestrians to engage in?
evidence: The study concluded texting is a major threat to pedestrian safety that will only get worse in the future.

question_sentence: Who was recently named “the most handsome man in the world” by the British newspaper Daily Mail?
evidence: The Daily Mail consulted a cosmetic surgeon who based their decision on facial proportions. The result? Robert Pattinson, of “Twilight” fame.

question_sentence: Donald Trump has delayed his plan to ban TikTok from operating in the US in order to pave the way for the sale of the Chinese-owned app to which major tech firm?
A Daily Mail audit has revealed that how many UK jobs are in danger of being cut in the fallout of the coronavirus pandemic?
Which chemical was responsible for the massive explosion that tore through the Lebanese capital Beirut on Tuesday?
Which unusual method are authorities at Dubai Airport using to detect Covid-19 cases in arriving passengers?
Virgin Galactic has revealed a concept for a supersonic passenger plane that could break the record for fastest flight time between London and New York. What is the current record?
During an argument at Pease Pottage service station in Sussex, a disgruntled man used which unusual object to “threaten” staff?
How many restaurants have signed up for the government’s Eat Out to Help Out scheme?
A series of "war games" predicted three states may attempt to secede from the US if Joe Biden loses to Donald Trump in the US election. Which of these was not one of them?
What radioactive element did the atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima contain?
The ex-king of which European country has gone into exile following the launch of an investigation into his finances by state prosecutors?
The Crew Dragon spacecraft returned to Earth, making it the first time a commercially developed spacecraft carried humans into orbit. What is the private company that developed the spacecraft?
evidence: SpaceX, led by billionaire magnate Elon Musk, designed the Crew Dragon spacecraft that brought NASA astronauts into space and safely returned to Earth. This also marked the first crewed spaceflight to launch from the US since the Space Shuttle program was retired in 2011.

question_sentence: NFL head coach Doug Pederson tested positive this week for Covid-19. What team does he coach for?
evidence: Philadelphia Eagles head coach Doug Pederson’s Covid-19 diagnosis comes amid growing coronavirus concerns with the NFL preseason already canceled and the regular season set to begin on September 10. Teams began reporting to training camp in July.

question_sentence: Nobel Laureate John Hume died at the age of 83. What did he receive the Nobel Peace Prize for?
choices: Negotiating the end to Apartheid in South Africa
Working to garner the Good Friday Agreement
Bringing an end to the Yugoslav Wars
evidence: John Hume received the Nobel Peace Prize for being one of the designers of the 1998 Good Friday Agreement. He received the award alongside David Trimble, both architects of the agreement that ultimately brought years of sectarian violence across Northern Ireland to an end.

question_sentence: According to newly released data by the FBI, the purchase of what in the United States skyrocketed in July 2020?
evidence: Almost 3.6 million background checks, which are associated with the sale, transfer and permitting of firearms, were issued in July 2020. Comparatively, just over 2 million were issued in July 2019. This came in the wake of mass restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic and unrest following the death of George Floyd at the hands of police officers in Minneapolis.

question_sentence: CEO Jim Hackett is retiring from what well-known American company?
evidence: Ford announced its CEO Jim Hackett will be retiring in October. Hackett has been CEO since May 2017 and is leaving Ford as companies like Tesla shake up the automobile industry.

question_sentence: A major explosion rocked which international port city, leaving thousands injured and hundreds either dead or missing?
evidence: An explosion ripped through the port of Beirut, destroying the area surrounding the blast and causing damage and injuries miles away. Though the exact cause remains unknown, Lebanese Prime Minister Hassan Diab said about 2,750 metric tons of ammonium nitrate, a highly explosive material, were stored at a warehouse without “proper preventative measures” since 2014.

question_sentence: A new CDC report found that 15 Americans were hospitalized due to methanol poisoning between May and June after consuming what type of product?
evidence: Fifteen adults in Arizona and New Mexico were hospitalized after drinking alcohol-based hand sanitizer, specifically made from methanol, a toxic substance that can also be absorbed through the skin. Some of the cases lead to seizures and even death. This comes as the FDA has banned more than 100 different hand sanitizer products.

question_sentence: Facebook removed a post from President Donald Trump’s page because it ran contrary to the company’s rules against misinformation. What was the post about?
evidence: Facebook deliberately removed a post from Trump’s page that featured an interview with Fox News incorrectly stating that certain groups, specifically children, are nearly immune from the coronavirus. For similar reasons, Twitter later took action against the Trump campaign for tweeting the same interview.

question_sentence: The Democratic National Convention, including Joe Biden’s nomination, will be almost entirely virtual due to the coronavirus pandemic. Where was it supposed to happen?
evidence: Officials announced that Joe Biden will no longer be accepting the Democratic presidential nomination in Milwaukee, instead opting to do it in his home state of Delaware. All major speeches are set to take place remotely from locations across the country.

question_sentence: August 6, 2020 marked the 75th anniversary of what major world-changing event?
choices: The conclusion of the Russian Revolution
D-Day and the invasion of Normandy
The dropping of the atomic bomb on Hiroshima
The start of the Korean War
evidence: The day marks the anniversary of the United States dropping an atomic bomb on Hiroshima, Japan, on August 6, 1945. A second atomic bomb was dropped on Nagasaki three days later. The two blasts killed more than 100,000 people. To this day, it’s the only time nuclear weapons have been used in warfare.

question_sentence: Michael Gove told the Lords’ Brexit Committee this week that the chances of a trade deal being agreed between the EU and UK stand at what percentage?
What unexpected occurrence at the US vice presidential debate between Mike Pence and Kamala Harris on Wednesday caused amusement on social media?
choices: A fly landed on Pence’s head

question_sentence: What percentage of people with Covid-19 are asymptomatic at the point of testing, according to a new study?
What was Donald Trump’s tweeted advice to Americans on Monday as he prepared to leave hospital to return to the White House following treatment for Covid-19?
choices: “Don’t allow Covid to control your brain.”

question_sentence: Who did Priti Patel accuse of ‘hooliganism and thuggery’ during her virtual Conservative Party conference speech?
choices: Black Lives Matter and Extinction Rebellion activists
The English Defence League and the BNP

question_sentence: A survey of 958 company directors by the Institute of Directors found that 74% intend to continue with what pandemic-related practice once Covid cases fall?
choices: Mandatory coronavirus tests for key staff

question_sentence: Liverpool FC have become the first reigning English top-flight champions to concede seven goals in a league match since what year?
How much did the Tories spend in campaigning costs for each of the 80 majority seats won in last December’s general election, according to newly released data?
The coronavirus pandemic has resulted in the release of new James Bond film No Time to Die being pushed back to when?
Jeff Bezos and the world’s other billionaires have seen their combined wealth rise to how much during the pandemic?
Thirteen people were arrested this week in connection with a plot to overthrow state governments and kidnap which state leader?
evidence: The plot, which was discovered by the FBI, is being cited as another worrying instance of the nation wide rise in vigilante justice incidents.

question_sentence: Spanish golfer Sergio Garcia won the PGA Tour Sanderson Farms Championship in Mississippi. How did he putt on the hole that brought him the win?
evidence: The Spaniard rolled the three-foot putt with his eyes closed – a technique he says he adopted to try to improve his putting. This was his first PGA Tour victory since 2017.

question_sentence: Which NFL team had to play a recent game without their quarterback because he tested positive for coronavirus?
evidence: The Patriots had to play their Monday night game against the Kansas City Chiefs without quarterback Cam Newton, who is one of several NFL players to recently test positive for Covid-19.

question_sentence: The National Zoo in Washington, DC announced the gender of a precious new baby animal in their family. What kind of animal is it?
evidence: The National Zoo announced that its latest-born giant panda cub was male. The announcement comes following DNA samples taken on September 19 during the cub’s first veterinary exam.

question_sentence: Acknowledging its derogatory name, the ice cream brand “Eskimo Pie” has committed to changing the name in early 2021. What will it be called?
evidence: Eskimo Pie, a subsidiary of Dreyer’s Grand Ice Cream, will be changing its name to Edy’s Pie, a tribute to the company’s founder, Joseph Edy. The name “Eskimo” is a term that has long been used by non-native groups to refer collectively to Inuit and Yupik people, according to the Alaska Native Language Center at the University of Alaska.

question_sentence: Which legendary guitarist passed away at the age of 65 this week?
evidence: Eddie Van Halen, guitarist of the iconic rock band Van Halen, died at the age of 65. His son, Wolf Van Halen, said in a social media post that his father died following a “long and arduous battle with cancer”.

question_sentence: Vice President Mike Pence and Democratic VP candidate Kamala Harris had a debate this week. What was NOT a viral moment that everyone was talking about afterward?
choices: a fly landing on Mike Pence’s head
the music played before the debate
evidence: While the event was certainly tamer than the first presidential event, people were focused on the plexiglass barriers on stage, the way the candidates looked at each other, and an unscheduled appearance by an errant fly.

question_sentence: Everyone’s at-home cooking routines have led to a shortage of what trendy (And useful) kitchen item?
evidence: Retailers and food experts say we’re doing an awful lot of canning and storing. That’s led to more Mason jars on our shelves — and less in the store.

question_sentence: What organization just won the 2020 Nobel Peace Prize?
evidence: The World Food Programme won the award for its “efforts to combat hunger” and its “contribution to bettering conditions for peace in conflict-affected areas.”

question_sentence: What industry is going through a particularly difficult time right now after a moratorium on layoffs lifted earlier this week? Republicans also floated a piecemeal stimulus bill to keep it afloat, but House Speaker Nancy Pelosi rejected the deal because she wants a more wide-ranging package.
evidence: Major airline carriers have announced thousands of layoffs and pay cuts, and industry leaders are saying they need government help to prevent more hardships.

question_sentence: How long was the delay granted to Meghan Markle in her privacy trial with The Mail on Sunday?
Low levels of which vitamin increase the odds of hospitalisation with Covid-19?
Which UK city has been found to be home to the largest number of rats?
Police are investigating an incident involving Labour leader Keir Starmer - but what happened?
choices: A Holborn shopkeeper accused him of stealing
He had a fight with a Conservative staffer outside the House of Commons
He broke royal protocol during a meeting at Buckingham Palace
He crashed his car into a cyclist

question_sentence: Special Forces commandos stormed a hijacked oil tanker off the cost of which of the UK’s islands?
A man in China has broken the world record for the most bees on a human body. How much did the bees weigh?
A student tricked several major newspapers into reporting the comeback of which long-closed shop?
What did Comic Relief announce they were axing this week?
choices: The biennial Red Nose Day show

question_sentence: How much has the UK’s much-maligned test-and-trace system cost?
Which of the following was one of just two people named in the EHRC report into anti-Semitism in Labour?
Military forces took control of the oil tanker Nave Andromeda after a suspected hijacking. Where did this happen?
evidence: British forces took control of the ship in the English Channel. Seven men were arrested in connection with the hijacking.

question_sentence: Amy Coney Barrett’s Supreme Court nomination was confirmed by the Senate and she was later sworn in. Who was the only Republican senator to vote against confirmation?
evidence: Sen. Susan Collins of Maine was the only Republican senator to vote with Democrats against Barrett’s nomination. The final vote was 52-48.

question_sentence: Tens of thousands of troops kicked off military exercises as a show of force to defend the Senkaku Islands. This is a coordinated effort between the US and which other country?
evidence: The US kicked off the joint military exercises — called Keen Sword 21 — with Japan, the country that has administered the island chain since 1972. It’s a direct challenge to China, which also claims jurisdiction over the islands.

question_sentence: What has been discovered on the sunlit surface of the moon for the first time?
evidence: NASA, with the help of its Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter and Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy airborne telescope, confirmed that trace amounts of water have been detected in soil on the sunlit surface of the moon.

question_sentence: Miles Taylor was identified as the “anonymous” author of a 2018 New York Times op-ed that spoke of an insider “resistance” within the Trump White House. In which federal agency was he a high-ranking official?
evidence: At the time of publication, Miles Taylor was deputy chief of staff to Department of Homeland Security Secretary Kirstjen Nielsen.

question_sentence: Walter Wallace Jr., a Black man, was shot and killed by police Monday afternoon, an episode that has led to protests and violent clashes in this city. Where did this happen?
evidence: Wallace was killed in Philadelphia and the incident was captured on video. He was brandishing a knife when police responded; his family says Wallace suffered from mental health issues, including bipolar disorder.

question_sentence: In a Senate Commerce Committee hearing this week, Ted Cruz accused which tech CEO of “behaving as a Democratic super PAC”?
evidence: Cruz went after Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey, specifically over his handling of a New York Post article involving unverified allegations about Hunter Biden. The hearing revolved around Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act, a law that protects a company’s ability to moderate content as it sees fit.

question_sentence: Another hurricane made landfall this week in Louisiana. What was the storm’s name?
evidence: Hurricane Zeta made landfall this week as a Category 2 storm. It marked the 27th storm of the Atlantic hurricane season, one shy of tying the record for most storms in a season.

question_sentence: A social media post revealed that actress Scarlett Johansson and which “SNL” star were recently married?
evidence: The charity Meals On Wheels divulged that Johansson and Colin Jost were married last weekend in an “intimate ceremony,” adding that the gathering had adhered to “COVID-19 safety precautions as directed by the CDC.”

question_sentence: Which airline announced a promotional travel campaign called the “flight to somewhere”?
evidence: Qantas announced its “flight to somewhere,” a 24-hour, round-trip experience from Sydney to Uluru — the famed sandstone monolith in Australia’s outback — aimed at Australian travelers. The promotion comes after its earlier “flight to nowhere” campaign.

question_sentence: A new analysis of government data has found that a total of how adults in the locked-down UK are being funded by the state?
Which university this week dismissed a student union motion to ban “hateful material” from its reading lists?
Police chiefs have warned that officers are sending the wrong message to the public during the Covid-19 crisis by doing what online?
choices: Singing and dancing in TikTok videos
Naming and shaming lockdown breakers on Facebook

question_sentence: Which Hollywood star is in talks with Nasa to film a movie in outer space?
What is the name of the secret information-sharing alliance between the UK, US, Australia, New Zealand and Canada?
Which country launched a new rocket into space this week as it steps up Moon landing plans?
As the Indian government begins repatriating citizens left stranded by coronavirus travel restrictions, how many Indian nationals in total currently reside abroad?
What are the UK authorities considering screening as part of plans aimed at preventing future coronavirus outbreaks?
The Ministry of Defence this week announced that around ten Isis militants have been killed in RAF air strikes on what in Iraq?
Italy has announced plans to give how many illegal workers the right to stay in the country?
What percentage of Brits would be ‘unlikely’ to agree to get a coronavirus vaccine, amid fears of adverse side-effects, according to a new poll?
Hollywood A-listers Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney are in talks to become investors in which football club?
European aircraft manufacturer Airbus this week announced plans to develop a fleet of new aircraft that will have which stand-out feature?
choices: Each aircraft will be able to carry more than 1,000 passengers
They will be the cheapest on the market

question_sentence: The Tory chair of the Foreign Affairs Committee, Tom Tugendhat, has claimed that which foreign power is driving a campaign in Barbados to remove Queen Elizabeth as head of state of the former British colony?
How many properties under the management of the National Trust have links to slavery and colonialism, according to a newly published report commissioned by the conservation charity?
Top German virologist Hendrik Streeck this week claimed that the UK can curb a second spike in coronavirus cases without needing to do what?
choices: Enforce quarantines for people who test positive for Covid

question_sentence: People infected with both flu and coronavirus have an increased risk of death of how much compared with the general population, according to new research?
How much was wiped off Tesla’s market value on Tuesday following a speech by company chief Elon Musk to shareholders?
A painting by street artist Banksy that is expected to sell for up to £5m at an upcoming Sotheby’s auction is a parody of an iconic work by who?
The Emmys were this week. Which show won the award for Outstanding Drama Series?
evidence: HBO’s “Succession” took home the top drama prize. The awards show, for the first time ever, had nominees streamed in from remote locations around the globe due to the pandemic.

question_sentence: Which US agency updated its website to say the coronavirus is spread “through respiratory droplets or small particles, such as those in aerosols” and then immediately removed the change?
choices: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
evidence: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention updated their website with the guidance and then immediately backtracked, saying that the change was a “draft version” and “posted in error.” This came after weeks of turmoil within the leadership at the HHS and CDC.

question_sentence: Trevor Milton was forced to step down as executive chairman of which electric vehicle startup after a short seller accused his company of misleading investors?
evidence: Trevor Milton stepped down from Nikola, a hydrogen and electric truck company, after accusations emerged that the company was misleading investors and embellishing the value of a business deal.

question_sentence: A tropical storm made landfall in Texas on Monday. What was its official name?
evidence: Tropical Storm Beta made landfall Monday with sustained wind speeds of 45 mph. Despite its slow speed, nearly 11 million people on the Texas and Louisiana coasts were put under flash-flood warnings as it made its way inland.

question_sentence: What fossilized evidence was found in Saudi Arabia suggesting that the earliest signs of human movement in the region may have occurred 120,000 years ago?
evidence: Researchers found the fossilized hominin footprints while surveying an ancient lake in Saudi Arabia’s Nefud Desert. If confirmed, it would be the earliest evidence of human movement on the Arabian Peninsula. Other footprints also were found, including those from horses, camels and elephants.

question_sentence: An 18-month-long mystery has been solved in the Welsh village of Aberhosan after frequent, unfixable outages of the community’s broadband internet. What was the culprit?
choices: Signals from a new cell phone
evidence: It was determined that an old television was to blame for the village’s internet woes. Investigating engineers said the problem was due to single high-level impulse noise (SHINE), a phenomenon that occurs in appliances that emit electrical signal and ultimately interfere with broadband connectivity.

question_sentence: The United States reached a dark milestone in coronavirus deaths this week. What number did the country surpass in total deaths?
evidence: The United States surpassed 200,000 deaths due to Covid-19, by far the most in the world. Twenty thousand flags were placed at the Washington Monument to commemorate the staggering loss.

question_sentence: What cost the US economy $16 trillion over the past 20 years, according to a new report by Citigroup?
evidence: Citigroup found that racism – specifically large gaps between White and Black communities in terms of  wages, education, housing and investment — has contributed to the $16 trillion loss over the last two decades.

question_sentence: Ninety-two years later, what has been done to the mold used as part of Andrew Fleming’s 1928 invention of penicillin?
choices: It’s been cryopreserved for eternal study
It was sent to Antarctica for testing
It was used  for coronavirus treatment
evidence: Fleming’s mold, which led to the invention of penicillin and has been critical in combating numerous diseases, has been genetically sequenced to aid in the fight against antibiotic resistance.

question_sentence: In what would be a first in the United States, what is Berkeley, California, seeking to ban from grocery store checkout aisles?
evidence: Junk food will be banned from being sold in and around grocery store checkout aisles and replaced by healthier foods. A “Healthy Checkout Ordinance,” approved unanimously by Berkeley’s City Council, is set to take effect in March 2021.

question_sentence: Scientists estimated that which ocean contains 12 to 21 million tons of microplastics in its top 200 meters?
In which African country did a military coup lead the president to resign after dissolving parliament?
Which wine has seen production slashed by 70 million bottles this year due to the coronavirus pandemic?
What is the name of the international organisation that has just Belarus and Russia as members?
choices: Union of Former Soviet Socialist Republics (UFSSR)

question_sentence: Gun crime in New York was almost three times higher last month than in 2019. But how many people were killed in gun murders in the city in 1990, the city’s deadliest year?
Which Hollywood actor this week sold his gin company to drinks giant Diageo as part of a $610m (£460m) deal?
Scotland has announced that it will hold socially distanced court trials in which public spaces?
Which country, the first to confirm a coronavirus case outside of China, has been rocked by student protests?
The government has announced plans to hike the price of rail season tickets by what percentage next year?
Joe Biden’s vice presidential pick, Kamala Harris,    gave a shoutout to her ‘chithis’, creating a buzz among Indian-Americans. What does the term mean?
The Democratic National Convention kicked off this week. What made it historic?
choices: It was held outside to ensure safe distancing
It was entirely virtual, done from remote locations
Former First Lady Michelle Obama gave the opening address
All speakers were people of color
evidence: The DNC, for the first time in history, made the convention entirely virtual due to coronavirus concerns. Politicians, celebrities and American voters streamed in from around the United States with Joe Biden even accepting his party’s presidential nomination from his home state of Delaware to an audience video conferencing in.

question_sentence: Two men were charged in the 2002 murder of legendary DJ Jam Master Jay. Which iconic hip hop group was he a part of?
evidence: Jam Master Jay, born Jason Mizell, was the DJ for hip hop group Run-DMC. Prosecutors from the Eastern District of New York announced the charges against Karl Jordan Jr. and Ronald Washington for the 2002 killing, finally moving the cold case forward.

question_sentence: The Earth recorded its hottest temperature in more than a century this week. Where?
evidence: Death Valley, in the California desert, reported a preliminary high temperature of 130 degrees Fahrenheit. If confirmed, this will be the hottest temperature recorded on Earth since 1913 – also in Death Valley — when the temperature reached 134 degrees.

question_sentence: Following months of strict lockdown, a Chinese city held a massive electronic music festival at the Maya Beach Water Park, drawing thousands of partygoers. In what city was it located?
evidence: The Maya Beach Water Park is located in Wuhan, the city considered ground zero for the coronavirus pandemic. Wuhan went through a 76-day lockdown that was lifted in early April, with the city not reporting a single coronavirus case since mid-May.

question_sentence: Louis DeJoy reversed course on changes to which US agency after several states filed federal lawsuits against it?
evidence: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy backed down on proposed changes to the US Postal Service, which included retail hour changes and removal of blue mail collection boxes, until after the November presidential election. Critics of the changes say they were an attempt at voter suppression by limiting mail-in voting. Answering to US senators on Friday, DeJoy said the USPS would “deliver every ballot and process every ballot in time that it receives.”

question_sentence: The ratification of the 19th Amendment saw its 100th anniversary this week. What did the Amendment grant in the United States?
choices: The right to a speedy and fair trial
The right for American women to vote
The right to free speech and religion
evidence: The 19th Amendment, ratified a century ago on August 18, 1920, guaranteed the right of American women to vote, a movement that had taken decades to come to fruition.

question_sentence: President Donald Trump’s former advisor Steve Bannon was arrested alongside three others for alleged fraud. What did the alleged crimes entail?
choices: Taking kickbacks from the Trump Organization
Using crowdfunded donations for personal expenses
Funneling money from federal agencies to personal accounts
evidence: Steve Bannon and three others were arrested by NY federal prosecutors and officials from US Postal Inspection Service for redirecting hundreds of thousands of dollars of crowdfunded donations for personal expenses. The crowdfunding campaign, known as We Build the Wall, was aimed at collecting funds for a private Mexico border wall and ultimately raised over $25 million.

question_sentence: In a rare rebuke of a sitting president, former President Barack Obama made an impassioned speech during the DNC against current President Donald Trump. In what city did he make his remarks?
evidence: Former President Obama made the speech from Philadelphia, a symbolic gesture as it is the city where the Declaration of Independence and United States Constitution were both drafted and ratified.

question_sentence: Widespread wildfires caused which US state to have the worst air quality on the planet?
evidence: Over 25 major fire incidents spanning hundreds of thousands of acres across California left the state with the worst air quality in the world, with experts putting it in the “very unhealthy” and “hazardous” range.
